title: Judge Approves 'Landmark' $650 Million Class-Action Suit Against Facebook Over Privacy Claims
text: A federal judge has approved a $650 million settlement of a class-action privacy lawsuit against Facebook that claimed the company used its facial recognition feature without user consent. What Happened: In 2015, Chicago attorney Jay Edelson filed a lawsuit against Facebook, Inc (NASDAQ: FB) in Cook County Circuit Court.

title: How Ad Revenue Powers Facebook's Entire Business
text: All of Facebook's platforms are free to use, but it's still the king of profiting from its users.

title: How Facebook Beats Pinterest And Snapchat At User Monetization
text: All of Facebook's platforms are free to use, but it's still the king of profiting from its users.

title: Antitrust Regulation And Facebook: We're in a Brave New World
text: Could regulators break up Facebook and what would that mean for investors?

title: How Facebook Is Using Its Data For Good in the Coronavirus Pandemic
text: Facebook's Head of Health KX Jin describes how the social media giant is supporting local COVID responses.

title: Can Facebook Help You Get Vaccinated?
text: We spoke with Facebook's Head of Health KX Jin about the social media giant's new campaign to help users find out when and where they can get their COVID vaccine.
